Authors: Yu-Ming Ju, Huei-Mei Hsieh, Xin-Sheng He
Title:
Xylaria coprinicola, a new species that antagonizes
cultivation of Coprinus comatus in China
Abstract:
The species known in China as the chicken-claw fungus is
described as a new species, Xylaria coprinicola. This species is known
as an antagonist of cultivation of the edible mushroom Coprinus comatus.
Stromata of X. coprinicola are cylindrical, terminate in a sterile apex
and arise in fascicles from a relative large submerged base; perithecia
are immersed and have conspicuously conical ostiolar openings;
ascospores are minute. Phylogenetic analyses based on combined partial
sequences of rpb2, b-tub and a-act genes showed that X. coprinicola is
closely related to those Xylaria species exclusively associated with
termite nests.
